WRITING.TITLE: [Chinese English] It's writing in a painting, I believe, of plum blossoms. It might be an artist's signature. I'm curious though overall what says.

WRITING.TEXT:
Oh wow, thanks for the education. I was not aware of that. Glad to know.
Blossoming in the winter sounds pretty cool.
Thanks again. I'll try a repost with Chinese in the title. I had, actually, originally posted this with CN/KR/JP in the title but didn't get any responses so then took a more focused approach.
Really, thanks again for your time, the brief cultural education, and your contribution to this sub! Really awesome thing to do.

obsession of the removal of materialistic things.
lol don't be coy with me. there's a difference.

I don't get it, green energy would be a new sector. You could have plants to make solar panels, and farms to run them. Same with wind turbines.
I don't see a problem with that really. There are jobs, people just aren't traind for them. Technology sector is where it's at. Looking back to jobs that are eitehr costing companies $1/hr wage outsourced or could be done by a robot isn't fixing the problem.

The thing we're not talking about is unemployment is at 5%. And we have jobs available we just need to train people for those jobs. Not being willing to learn the new trades of the 21st century is what's holding America back. Plus most factories are automated by robots nowadays. Looking toward manufacturing as your savior is naive at best and completely foolhardy at worst. But technology and software development? Plenty of room there for jobs.
Besides, Trump's picking at talking points without knowing the whole situation. Many of these companies do have factories in the U.S. BMW oncluded.
The reality is, for the average job, you won't be a 50 cent/hour wage no matter how much you tariff it.

was she out of character? or is this her character coming to fruition and finally being realized as the weak one who was strung along and is still being strung along by him? Like Nina said she was, being used.
I'm not saying you're wrong, just there might be a bit more behind her motivations. This show needs to be read like a book. He's a literary figure, or at least his story certainly was through the affair. Now it's kind of turned into this tragic downfall. Helen, who always loved him, is trying to help him, again.
It's not so much she just didn't leave his life, you have to consider why. And she's always held this small sliver of hope for way too long that it could be forgotten. Now take into account an immense guilt she feels. I mean, she owes him. No way around it. How do you pay that back? Someone doing a bid for you like that?
So to make it so clear cut that, come on Helen, wtf?! Isn't really fair to the past. Sure it's been years but he only got out of prison, she only got her chance to start making it right now when he was released.
I don't know if it's she's entirely oblivious. She want's to help but doesn't know where to start. To some extent it's an unfair expectation for her to know how to help someone who is an addict out of prison. She'd never have the slightest clue what is going on with someone like that.
What she needs to do is start telling the truth. Or enough of a truth. That he wasn't driving that night and he was protecting someone else from going to prison. Let people speculate whether it was her or Allison.
As for the lying, it seems just like that secret, helping him and the why needs to be a secret because of its origin.

i think a more fitting question would be do we feel some pain? a short pike in heartbeat that then goes down, maybe the person felt the initial pain or maybe a constant discomfort of poking and prodding, like the dentist?
really this is all made moot because the drugs used while you were knocked out are the same drugs your on as you wake up. and often you're not in pain when you wake up and before you're given oral or more IV painkillers without the knockout effect.

ai too. also medicine. and depending on how we continue to develop construction materials possibly those too. and there's the fusion experiments, https://www.iter.org/.
i think yall are downplaying some major major contributions to how a society could or arguably needs to advance.
then there's things like antibiotic resistant bacteria. like the invention of penicillin and within 100 years or so the resistance to it? and then there's CRISPR, aka super affordable gene splicing. which they're using to potentially eradicate lime disease changing a whole species ability to carry it, http://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/08/science/ticks-lyme-disease-mice-nantucket.html.
and in 30 years or 40, maybe 50, you might even be able to make diseases at home gene editing and building will be so affordable. then what?
i mean, i honestly think we're more likely to be remembered for finally inventing something that fucking ended it all rather than anything else. or some major fuck up that led to major innovation.
and i'm really not sure how any of us are having this conversation without mentioning global warming. the inventions that come out of trying to give people places to live and ways and means will probably be heralded as critical.

WRITING.TEXT:
As someone who casts and has a bit of appreciation for how difficult it is, don't even address the haters.
i do give you a lot of credit for trying to address the haters. Most people will never understand the idea of not speaking on something they haven't experienced.
Ultimately it's vastly more important to entertain the veiwers than it is to pick up on every single thing that's happenening. Especially when casting you're looking for the next 2, 3, 4 things taht are going to happen because of that artanis switch so trying to highlight it all or in a sense 'go back' isn't going to work. The game just moves too fast. Again, something you wouldn't get unless you've casted.
And I recommend you go and try to cast. Take a replay and cast. I did when learning how to. I"m sure Khaldor spent time casting replays to no one in particular. I personally spent time practicing just the play by plays and time spent just talking about the match and transitioning to the play by plays and fights. As a whole though entertainment is the goal. Not every single ability called out.
it's late game but i think kara's 3 person radiant dash cleanse might have some value here.
